moves.1... d5: On the theory of "we've tried everything else against her."
moves.3. Nc3: Strong and natural, forcing the Queen to move again.
moves.3... Qd8: The alternative move is 3... Q-QR4, but this seemed safer.
moves.4... e6: A natural reply, stopping P-Q5 and opening a line for the KB to develop.
moves.5. Bd3: T. M. was shocked at this move. I remember him poking me with his elbow, as if to say, "I can't believe she made a mistake!"
moves.5... Qxd4: T. M. snags the loose Pawn. What he missed was...
moves.6. Bb5+: Checking the King and attacking the Queen. T. M. looked disgusted as he resigned... not that he lost to her, but that it happened so darn fast!

gameName: I'm the observer, not the victim this time
